title: ALT-TAB during loading screen.
body:
I just reinstalled the game after formatting the hard-disk completely and i cannot alt-tab AT ALL ! Tried CTRL-ESC also CTRL-ALT-DELETE won't help either. 

Before, i could only alt-tab if i was spamming it just as it prompted me. All my friends have such problems with it. I am sure a lot of you do as well. I remember encountering problems with alt-tabbing while in loading screen for like 2 years now.

replies.body: Shot in the dark here, but alt-tab doesn't do anything if you have no other active windows open. Try opening a browser or something in the background before the game starts if you had nothing else running!
What's the point in alt-tabbing otherwise ? Thanks for your involvement anyway ^^.
Do you experience this in all windowed modes or just in full-screen? This could be caused by some OS or hardware problems or it could be a simple setting. Let me know, thanks.

I'm only playing in full-screen. It is "working" now. By working i mean just as it used to work all these years. I can only alt-tab during loading screen if i spam alt-tab just as the loading screen is prompted. If you're not fast enough, you'd have to wait like 10-15 seconds in loading screen to be able to alt-tab then. CTRL - ALT - DELETE won't work either but the settings will prompt. Anyway, choosing task manager or pressing alt-tab therefore won't do anything, just bring you back to the loading screen.

Hope i was clear enough.
Can you switch to Borderless windowed mode to see if you experience the same behavior? You can find the setting in-game under VIDEO. Let me know!

I will have to get in game, then start another game. And even if it wouldn't, i'm pretty sure i don't like the borderless mode. I will try, if i don't forget to change it at the end of the match.

EDIT : I doubt it's caused by a windows settings. By the time i posted that, i had just installed windows 10. And it's been happening to me on 8.1 pro 64bit and windows 7 both 64 and 32 bits as well.
You can make the changes fairly quickly in a custom match with no bots or human players. I suspect it would be a good test environment for these changes.

I tried it and i have no problems alt-tabbing at any point. I see no difference from the fullscreen mode since im playing on the monitor's native resolution. I think i'll stick with it then, thanks for help.

I know exactly what you mean, and I can say that once your cursor pops up, whether it be your white default cursor or the league hand thing, you will be safe to alt tab without consequence.

I know it takes a bit, but that's the fastest solution I could come up with.
